Summary: Very large bright plasma white ball traveling slow suddenly went out.

divs: sighting details my son and i were on a nightly walk looking up at clear starry night when we suddenly noticed a "very" white bright ball gliding like maybe at 2k ft to 3k ft high. at first we thought airplane but the light was so unusual we kept an eye on it. speed maybe 400 miles an hour, made no sound. after 40 some seconds of viewing the bright light just simply went off, nothing there at all. unlike airplanes this had no blinking lights; it was just solid very bright white. my son said it reminded him of looking into a white led flashlight it was so true white. it was no police helicopter, which we sometimes see. i believe i can confidently say this was no meteor gliding through the atmosphere. there was no vapor trail; it traveled level to the ground and almost over our heads. any meteor i���������ve seen flickers, this object was rock solid light. we saw the object walking in the north garland texas area south of fire wheel mall. this part of garland is part of dfw airport flight circle. no plane is ever over here unless it's lit up with blinking lights\red light\ yellowish lights. we purposely observed all planes after that they were all fully lit up and stayed that way. granted some airplanes can change angle and you lose some sight of the lights but this object in front of us seem to disappear.
